DataElement.longName: Molecular Analysis Amino Acid Change Text
DataElement.definition: Alphanumeric value used to describe the amino acid change for a specific genetic variant.

DataElementConcept.definition: A laboratory procedure that involves the study of tissues, cells, and fluids using DNA/RNA analysis techniques for the identification of characteristics and abnormalities at the molecular level._Any organic compounds containing amino (-NH2) and carboxyl (-COOH) groups.  In biochemistry, used to refer to the twenty-plus L-alpha-amino acids found in proteins._The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for caDSR Requests Q12018 Dictionary Updates for Review (supplement) 3.15.18 mc

ObjectClass.definition: Techniques for studying or analyzing the genetic composition and mechanisms of living organisms at the molecular level. May refer to the understanding and manipulation of genes (DNA).

Concepts.definition: A laboratory procedure that involves the study of tissues, cells, and fluids using techniques to analyze biologically active molecules, including nucleic acids, proteins, lipids and carbohydrates, for the identification of processes, characteristics and abnormalities at the molecular level.

Property.definition: Organic compounds containing amino (-NH2) and carboxyl (-COOH) groups.  In biochemistry, used to refer to the twenty-plus L-alpha-amino acids found in proteins.:The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.

Concepts.definition: The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.
Any organic compounds containing amino (-NH2) and carboxyl (-COOH) groups.  In biochemistry, used to refer to the twenty-plus L-alpha-amino acids found in proteins.

ValueDomain.definition: The text that provides a description of a topic.
